data_quality.tier_rationale: CRITICAL FINDING: No. 94 Squadron SAAF does not appear to have existed. Extensive research across authoritative sources (historyofwar.org SAAF squadron index, Wikipedia, SAAF official sources) confirms no SAAF squadron numbered 94. No. 94 Squadron RAF existed and operated in North Africa, but was Royal Air Force, not South African Air Force. Seed file entry appears to be based on Wikipedia Desert Air Force article error that incorrectly listed 'No. 94 Squadron SAAF' in Nov 1941 order of battle.

metadata.validation_notes: Research brief created instead of extraction due to unit non-existence

research_brief.summary: No. 94 Squadron SAAF does not appear to have existed as a South African Air Force unit during World War 2

authoritative_sources_consulted: historyofwar.org Subject Index: SAAF Squadrons, Second World War - Lists squadrons 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 28, 30, 31, 32, 34, 40, 41, 43, 44, 50, and 60. NO squadron 94.
Wikipedia: List of squadrons of the South African Air Force - No squadron 94 mentioned
Wikipedia: South African Air Force - No squadron 94 in WWII section
Wikipedia: History of the South African Air Force - No squadron 94 mentioned
DefenceWeb: SAAF Squadrons present and past - No squadron 94 listed
Wikipedia: Desert Air Force - Lists SAAF squadrons 1, 2, 4, 5, 7, 12, 21, 24, 40, 60 in Oct 1942 order of battle. NO squadron 94 in late 1942.
No. 94 Squadron RAF History - Confirms No. 94 Squadron was RAF, operated Hurricanes/Kittyhawks in North Africa
Multiple web searches for 'No. 94 Squadron SAAF' returned zero results
detailed_findings.likely_explanation: The seed file entry appears to be based on an error in the Wikipedia Desert Air Force article, which listed 'No. 94 Squadron SAAF (Hurricanes)' in the 262 Wing section of a November 1941 organizational chart. However, this is contradicted by all other authoritative sources. No. 94 Squadron RAF (Royal Air Force) did exist and operated in North Africa with Hurricanes, but was NOT a South African Air Force unit.

no_94_squadron_raf.operations: Converted from Kittyhawks back to Hurricanes in May 1942. Flew defensive patrols through El Alamein period. Not SAAF.

no_30_squadron_saaf.formation: Formed 12 August 1944 from RAF No. 223 Squadron at Pescara, Italy
no_30_squadron_saaf.note: Seed file states '94 Squadron SAAF later became 30 Squadron SAAF' but 30 Squadron was formed from RAF 223 Squadron, NOT from a squadron 94

94 Squadron SAAF 1942 Kittyhawk P-40 Desert Air Force

South African Air Force squadron 94 history formation disbanded
SAAF squadron 94 30 Baltimore light bomber 1942 redesignation
zero_results_searches: No. 30 Squadron SAAF Baltimore bomber 1942 formation history

recommendations.immediate: Remove No. 94 Squadron SAAF from air units seed file (north_africa_air_units_seed_COMPLETE.json)
recommendations.verification: Cross-check all seed file entries against authoritative squadron indexes (historyofwar.org, official air force histories) before extraction
recommendations.data_correction: If Hurricane fighter squadron coverage desired for 1942 Q4, consider adding legitimate SAAF squadrons that operated Hurricanes: No. 1 Squadron SAAF, No. 40 Squadron SAAF (if they operated Hurricanes during this period)
alternative_units: No. 1 Squadron SAAF - Operated Hurricanes, part of Desert Air Force
No. 2 Squadron SAAF - Operated Kittyhawks, confirmed in 1942 Q4
No. 4 Squadron SAAF - Operated Kittyhawks, confirmed in 1942 Q4
No. 5 Squadron SAAF - Operated Tomahawks/Kittyhawks, confirmed in 1942 Q4
No. 7 Squadron SAAF - Operated anti-tank Hurricanes, confirmed in 1942 Q4

current_entry.notes: Returned to operational light bomber duties May 1942 with Baltimore, supporting Eighth Army. Later became 30 Squadron SAAF

errors_identified: Unit designation: No. 94 Squadron SAAF does not exist
Nation: If referring to RAF squadron, should be 'british' not 'south_african'
Aircraft type: Notes mention Baltimore light bomber, but entry lists Hurricane fighter - inconsistent
Squadron 30 SAAF connection: 30 Squadron formed from RAF 223 Squadron in 1944, not from squadron 94
Source attribution: Wikipedia Desert Air Force article contains error
seed_file_correction_needed.proposed_action: DELETE this entry from seed file and replace with verified SAAF fighter squadrons if Hurricane coverage needed
